metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9649 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the management plugin in RabbitMQ 2.1.0 through 3.4.x before 3.4.1 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the path info to api/, which is not properly handled in an error message.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9649` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

rabbitmq-server - 3.4.2-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: rabbitmq-server package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.2-2').
